column4: Most probably you are already in /mnt/windows. Please do a cd ..
I am in my user root
Then also please check that there is no nautilus or any other application accessing /media/windows
I don't see any reason for the problem then. Can you specify the command you gave?
sudo mount /dev/hdb    with fstab /dev/hdb        /media/windows  ntfs    nls=utf8,umask=0222   0       0
It is not about what he wants to play. He wants to play files on network storage.
He would still need to be able to play the stream?
then why don't you add it yourself?
It was, and should be using the new drive, the old drive did not have any room left on it. I have been FLACing all my cds... THat is why I am confused!
Paste your fstab in pastebin and then I may help you
